abstract: Independent investigation into Jimmy Savile sexual abuse scandal commissioned by BBC issues 700-page report; asserts broadcaster knew about abuses by Savile and others and blames lack of discipline on corporate culture discouraging whistle blowing and promoting deference to celebrities; notes fear of reprisals still persists at organization where jobs are highly coveted and scarce.

headline.print_headline: BBC Corporate Culture Allowed Sexual Abuse to Flourish, Investigation Finds
headline.main: Jimmy Savile Inquiry Accuses BBC of Failing to Report Sexual Abuse

snippet: A three-year investigation concluded that the TV personality had raped at least eight people during his time at the company, including an 8-year-old.
lead_paragraph: A three-year investigation concluded that the TV personality had raped at least eight people during his time at the company, including an 8-year-old.
